titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 807) to require that the Government prioritize all obligations on the debt held by the public in the event that the debt limit is reached.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-52, by Mr. Sessions.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 807 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit with or without instructions allowed. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 23.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 202.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 202, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Slaughter demanded the yeas and nays, and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 227 - 199 (Roll no. 138).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 199 (Roll no. 139).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/7/2013--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 807) to require that the Government prioritize all obligations on the debt held by the public in the event that the debt limit is reached.
